required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Medical Data Collection of Patients With Head and Neck Cancer Treated With Proton Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Data Collection of Patients Treated With Proton Therapy for Head and Neck Malignancies

brief_summary.textblock: This trial collects medical information from patients with head and neck cancer that have received or are scheduled to receive proton therapy. Collecting and analyzing medical information from patients may provide information on the outcomes and treatment related side effects of proton therapy for head and neck cancer and help doctors improve therapy for future patients with head and neck cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
I. To evaluate the outcomes in patients who have received treatment for their head and neck malignancy with proton radiation therapy.
OUTLINE:
Patients complete questionnaires over 30 minutes before treatment begins, at each visit during treatment, and again at all follow-up visits related to treatment. Patients also have their medical records reviewed.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall survival analysis of proton therapy for head and neck malignancies
primary_outcome.description: Chart analysis performed on all patients documented to have head and neck cancer treated with proton therapy from January 1, 2008 through December 31, 2014. Overall survival estimated using Kaplan-Meier method. Cox proportional hazards regression used to explore predictors of time-to-event outcomes. Mann-Whitney test used to compare continuous parameters between temporal cohorts.

arm_group.description: Patients complete questionnaires over 30 minutes before treatment begins, at each visit during treatment, and again at all follow-up visits related to treatment. Patients also have their medical records reviewed.

study_pop.textblock: Patients documented to have head and neck cancer treated with proton therapy at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston, Texas (MDACC) from January 1, 2008 through April 30, 2012, and patients who receive treatment from May 1, 2012 through December 31, 2018

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients documented to have head and neck cancer treated with proton therapy at MDACC from January 1, 2008 through April 30, 2012 and patients who receive treatment from May 1, 2012 through December 31, 2018
